section: In the event that the parties are unable to agree to an SOW within 2 months following the Effective Date, either party may, in its sole discretion, terminate this Agreement by providing written notice.
explanation: Section 2.2 states that if the parties do not agree to a SOW within 2 months either party may terminate. Section 2.3 states that if the launch date has not occurred within 4 months after the effective date, either party may terminate. These sections seem misaligned in purpose. They both set a deadline, and if either party doesn't meet the deadline, the other party can terminate. However, agreeing to a SOW and setting a launch date are different things.

section: The formula for arriving at the per Transaction Inquiry amount may be revised from time to time during the term of this Agreement to reflect present market conditions ("the Adjusted Rate"), unilaterally by 2TheMart without requiring i-Escrow's consent. The Adjusted Rate will be communicated to i-Escrow and will be effective immediately.
explanation: This clause gives 2TheMart the unilateral right to change the advertising fees without i-Escrow's consent. Although 2TheMart must communicate the new rate, i-Escrow has no recourse. This could be considered unconscionable or lacking good faith, since one party has complete control over the payment terms without the other party's agreement.

section: Sections 1, 7, 8.5 [EFFECTS OF TERMINATION], 9, 10, 11 and 12 shall not survive expiration or termination of this Agreement.
explanation: This sentence specifies which sections do not survive termination. However, Section 9 provides an indemnity clause, and indemnification obligations typically survive termination of an agreement. By stating that Section 9 does not survive termination, it creates an ambiguity and potential legal contradiction since the indemnity obligations would cease upon termination, defeating the purpose of such a clause.
